intro: Macrolobium taxifolium, commonly known as the featherleaf macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves that resemble feathers, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens.
